ygData.subject: AW: [eqbards] Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: your problem will solve in some time when you get better equip. then you will have more STR and weight reducing bags so its no problem to carry around many
ygData.messageBody:
your problem will solve in some time when you get better equip. then you
will have more STR and weight reducing bags so its no problem to carry
around many parts of armor.
personally, i always carry many parts with me, and switch depending on game
situation. when i know i need AC i wear the SS helm, when i am CC and have
to mezz/charm i wear the kobold jesters crown. same with rings
(stats/resists/ac) bracer (resists/ac/stats) and boots (SS for effect,
imbrued for stats and resists).
in general, i would suggest going for stats, because you will mostly not be
beaten on. and if you get hit, the ac will not matter that much. so wear the
imbrued helm for good CHA and leave the SS helm in bank. you also have less
weight then.

tobi
57
tholuxe paells

-----Urspr├╝ngliche Nachricht-----
Von: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
Gesendet am: Dienstag, 5. Februar 2002 23:11
An: Eqbards (E-mail)
Betreff: [eqbards] Armor

Dilemma...I have some Singing Steel, and I have some Imbrued. Problem is,
the pieces duplicate. Example, I have SS helm and Imbrued helm, SS arms and
Imbrued arm...etc. What is considered "better"? SS is real nice AC, but
it's leaving my stats lacking. Imbrued has some pretty good stats, but at
the cost of some AC.

Some have mentioned they carry 2 sets of armor. I'd rather not do that,
since I quickly get encumbered now as it is. Currently, my "fresh from the
bank going out to do stuff" weight is around 80/113. Add some armor to
that, and I'll be starting out encumbered.

Also, I really need to look at my shoulder, back, and waist slots. My
shoulders is still blood stained mantle, back is, I think decent, but don't
know what my options are, and my waist is the Straw Spun Belt. Decent AC at
10, but at 6 weight, I think it's too heavy. I wouldn't mind options that I
could go and get myself solo, but I have a 51 shaman friend who can help.
Oh, I'm 50, finally. :)

Any and all suggestions are very welcome.

Thanks!

Atonal
